editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Thompson Family Charitable Trust

msDesc.head: Raymund of Peñaforte and Gregory, Cura pastoralis

supportDesc.support: Comprising two probably separate MSS, both on vellum (FSOS/FHHF and HSOS/HFFH respectively).
supportDesc.condition: The leading edges of fols. 93 and 96 have been cut away.

decoDesc.decoNote: In the original parts of Manuscript 1: headings in red.
At the head, a 7-line red and blue lombard on red and blue flourishing.
At internal divisions, 3- and 4-line alternating red and blue lombards on flourishing of the other colour.
Alternating red and blue paraphs to divide the text.
In the original parts of Manuscript 2: headings and marginal notations of authorities in red.
Alternating red and blue 2-line lombards on flourishing of the other colour.
Red-slashed capitals at heads of sentences to divide the text.

binding.p: A modern replacement. Sewn on five thongs. Holes and rust from strap mountings, running through to fol. 1. At the front, one modern paper flyleaf, one medieval vellum flyleaf (perhaps from a wrapper); at the rear, two medieval vellum flyleaves and one of modern paper (iii–v).

origin.origDate: s. xiii med. and in., with additions, ss. xiii med., ss. xiv in., xiv1, and xiv med.

history.provenance: ‘Henr’ Wad’ eadward Roch et blake kempe’ (fol. 88v, the upper margin, in lead; s. xiii ex. or xiv in.).
Very faded accounts in lead, on the last two pages the entries ticked with a red dot at the head (fols. ii, iiiv–iv, s. xiii/xiv).
The remains of a medieval shelfmark ‘..111’? (fol. iiv).
history.acquisition: In the Benefactors’ Book, col. ii, among the books donated by John White in 1555, as ‘Raimundi Letardi summae et Pastorale Gregorij MS’.

source.bibl: Ralph Hanna, A descriptive catalogue of the western medieval manuscripts of St. John's College, Oxford (Oxford: Oxford University Press, 2002)

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact St John's College Library.

listBibl.bibl: Claude W. Barlow (ed.), Martini episcopi Bracarensis opera omnia (New Haven, 1950).
Morton W. Bloomfield et al., Incipits of Latin Works on the Virtues and Vices, 1100–1500 A.D., Including a Section of Incipits of Works on the Pater Noster (Cambridge Mass., 1979).
Eligius Dekkers and Aemilius Gaar, Clavis patrum latinorum, 3rd edn. (Turnhout, 1995).
Bruno Jadic et al. (eds), Règle pastorale, Sources chretiénnes 381–2 (1992).
T. Kaeppeli, Scriptores Ordinis Praedicatorum Medii Aevi, 4 vols. (Rome, 1970–93).
Dag Norberg (ed.), S. Gregorius Magnus : Registrum epistularum, Corpus Christianorum 140 (1982).

msItem.incipit: Iudeus quidam sub caucione bona tradidit cuidam cristiano quandam summam pecunie
msItem.explicit: homines predictos communicare et hec videns conuersus est iudeus ad fidem
msItem.incipit: [fol. 138v] De Memoria mortis et die iudicii et penis inferni Quidam rex erat qui quanto maiorem tenebat curiam tanto tristior erat
msItem.explicit: mors sine fine ignis inextinguibilis frigus intollerabile et alie pene innumerabilis
msItem.incipit: Legitur in vita patrum quod ortolanus quidam quicquid habere poterat
msItem.explicit: Omnibus rebus omnibusque sermonibus ad salutar’ miscendum est
msItem.title: Three exempla

handDesc.handNote: written in the same anglicana hand, s. xiv1 or s. xiv2/4.

msItem.note: Pusilla res est hominis anima sed uigens res contemptus anime’, ‘Anselmus Qui plangit peccata sua et non deserit in maiora culpe se beneficit’, ‘Gregorius Non inueitur inuenitur suplicium quo digne puniatur ingratitudinis vicium’, ‘Rem tege gaudebis sed detegis forte carebi '.
msItem.title: Added notes in different hands

layoutDesc.layout: above two musical staves, of five and four lines.

msContents.textLang: Latin with added texts in Anglo-Norman

msItem.incipit: Quoniam ut ait Ieronimus Secunda tabula post naufragium est culpam simpliciter confiteri
msItem.explicit: corrigenda uiderit et addenda non inuidendi animo set benigne corrigat et emendet Explicit
msItem.author: RAYMUND OF PEÑAFORTE
msItem.note: Summa de paenitentia, with De matrimonia (Kaeppeli 3:283–7, nos. 3407–8), first published Rome, 1603 (rept. Farnborough: Gregg Press, 1967). A great many marginal corrections; on fols. 67v–8, a protracted marginal gloss for topics discussed here on oral confession.
Added texts, written in on blank leaves at the end of the last quire:

msItem.incipit: Ki uudra beaus e bin uestu aparer deuant la face ihesu il couient kil eit une robe kad anum confessiun ki bien cest robe
msItem.explicit: ne peot recunter Ne quer ne suffist a penser Amen
msItem.title: An Anglo-Norman treatise on confession, unidentified.
msItem.note: In double columns, each column 188 65 , with 9 mm between columns, in 52 lines to the column. Written in gothic textura semiquadrata, s. xiii med., below top line. At the head, a 3-line blue lombard on red flourishing; alternate red and blue paraphs.

msItem.incipit: Gloriossimo ac tranquillisimo et insigni catholice fidei predito pietate Mironi regi MARTINUS episcopus humiliter Non ignoro clementissime rex flagrantissimam animi tui sitim sapiencie [the text] Quatuor uirtutum species multorum sapiencium sentenciis diffinite sunt quibus humanus animus
msItem.explicit: te facient uirum si mensuram rectitudinis earum eque fine seruaueris
msItem.incipit: Prudencia Iusticia fortitudo Temperancia Prudencia est diuinarum humanarumque rerum meditacio
msItem.explicit: in bonis operis et uictoria contra omnia uiciorum genera Temperancia est tocius uite modus [added later:] Explicit Sex modis discrecio personarum habenda est Tribus modis secundum dignitatem quia superioribus obedienciam timorem
msItem.author: MARTIN OF BRAGA
msItem.title: Formula uitae honestae

note.p: (CPL 1080), ed. Claude W. Barlow, Martini episcopi Bracarensis opera omnia (New Haven, 1950), 236–50, ending at ch. 6/3 (with ‘seruaueris’). At the end of the text, brief definitions of the four virtues (neither Cicero’s nor Macrobius’) and the start of an additional note.
In the same page format as the preceding, but a gothic textura rotunda, s. xiii med. Two-line red and blue lombards on flourishing of the other colour.

msItem.incipit: A deu e a madame seinte e a tuz les seynz notre seygnur e a vus pere espirital me renk culpable
msItem.explicit: ke deu mad dune en mun age e en ma lunge de mere en ceste vie [with an added conclusion across the page foot:] e del seint espirit de tuz mes pechez requer merci e pardun e de vus pere espirital absoluciun
msItem.title: An Anglo-Norman form of confession
msItem.note: In double columns, each column 203 60 and 70 , with 9–11 mm between columns, in 56 lines to the column. The same scribe as the preceding item. No decoration.

collation.catchwords: Catchwords under the inner column, most cut away;
collation.signatures: signatures on fols. 81–3, 85, in rubricator’s red, leaf numbers only.

layoutDesc.layout:
In double columns, each column
180–5 65 and 60 , with 9 mm between columns, in 55 lines to the column. Regular prickings to fol. 20; bounded and ruled in black and brown ink.

handDesc.handNote: Written in gothic textura rotunda, above top line (given the text, the MS must postdate 1234). Punctuation by medial point.

msContents.textLang: Latin with some added material in Anglo-Norman

msItem.rubric: In nomine domini Liber regule pastorum GREGORII pape scriptus ad Iohannem episcopum
msItem.incipit: Gregorius episcopus seruus seruorum dei seruis dei nostri Quia melius fuerat bona non incipere quam ab hiis que cepta sunt
msItem.rubric: [fol. 93vb] Incipit prologus libri pastoralis cure editus a sancto papa GREGORIO
msItem.incipit:
Pastoralis cure me pondera fugere delitescendo uoluisse benigna
[fol. 94ra, the text] Nulla ars doceri presumitur nisi intenta prius meditacione discatur
msItem.explicit: de precipuis actibus non audeant superbire
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber pastoralis editus a beato GREGORIO
msItem.incipit: Ecce bone uir reprehensionis mee necessitate compulsus
msItem.explicit: tabula sustine ut quia pondus proprium deprimit tui meriti manus leuet Explicit
msItem.author: GREGORY
msItem.title: Cura pastoralis
msItem.note: CPL 1712, ed. Bruno Jadic et al., Règle pastorale, SC 381–2 (1992), preceded by GREGORY, epistola 6.53, ed. Dag Norberg, CC 140 (1982), 426. A table of chapters follows the initial letter (fols. 93ra–vb).

msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus de carne superba que animam perdit
msItem.incipit: Ad te manum meam extendo quem sencio in timore dei tenere uexillum
msItem.explicit: prouocat homicidium caro penetrat ad ulterium caro admittit rixam caro in
msItem.title: Tractatulus de carne superba

msItem.note: Added texts, written on the blank leaves of the last quire and an added bifolium:

msItem.incipit: Arrogantia est animi motus quo quis mouetur ad iactandum se habere [fol. 135vb, Anglo-Norman begins] Ceo sunt les especes de orguyl vayne glorie vareyment ypocrisye Ireuerence Inobedience
msItem.explicit: choses cas seyn et lyn et feistes autre chose en seynte eglise ke orer
msItem.title: Latin distinctiones giving definitions of the ‘parts’ of each deadly sin, alternating with comparable material in Anglo-Norman.

note.p: In double columns, in carefully written portions, each column 202 60 , with 10 mm between columns, in 44 lines to the column; the presentation becomes progressively less formal. Written in anglicana, s. xiv in.

msItem.note: ‘Nonne sum satis pro te afflictus pro tua culpa auferenda wlneratus noli me vlterius infligere certe plus grauabit me wlnus peccati tui quam wlnus lateris mei’.
msItem.title: A brief note, Jesus addressing the Christian from the cross
msItem.note: written in anglicana, s. xiv med.

collation.formula: 9–1112 128 132 (a later addition by the scribe responsible for item f).
collation.catchwords: Two added catchwords under the inner column.
collation.signatures: Fragmentary signatures, apparently all leaves in each quire assigned a letter a–m.

layoutDesc.layout:
In double columns, each column
205–10 60–5 , with 10 mm between columns, in 46 lines to the column. Frequent prickings; bounds and rules in black and brownish ink.

handDesc.handNote: Written in gothic textura semiquadrata, s. xiii in. above top line. Punctuation by point and punctus elevatus, many points ‘corrected’ to virgulae later.
